Overview¶

Hotcat follows the consumer-producer pattern. There is a manager that manages all tasks and communication between all other modules via tcp, the so called QueueManager. Therefore it is necessary that the QueueManager runs. All other modules can then connect to the QueueManager and pick up or deliver tasks. Each module runs in a separate process, but it is not necessary that all modules run. By default, all modules are started, but this can be changed in the settings. For details see section Usage. The modules are located in different packages. In the following a short description of each module.

server Package¶


  • queue_manager module

    manages the tasks and communication between all other modules via tcp. It is based on Python’s multiprocessing.managers.BaseManager

  • web module

    provides an minimal web server which handles incoming user requests from the web frontend.



worker Package¶


  • input_worker module

    fetches every month the top 1 million domains from Alexa, prepares them and puts them to the QueueManager.

  • sslyze_worker module

    getting domains from the QueueManager, analyze the TLS configuration of the servers and putting results back to the manager.

  • result_worker module

    getting sslyze results from the QueueManager, format it and make it persistent.



helper Package¶


  • status module

    this module prints current status of the scan process. It can be used standalone to get the status if other processes running in the background. By default it will be started by hotcat.py, but it can be changed in settings.

    if all modules are started, then you can run:

    $ python helper/status.py

    to get current status of the scan process.

  • dumper module

    this module is used by the QueueManager to periodically dump the state. The QueueManager can use the dump to restore the state next time.

  • cipher_desc module

    this holds the cipher description of each cipher string. It is used by the result_worker to get the cipher description by given cipher name.
